text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
This transmits revised IRM 7.14.4, Employee Plans EDS User Manual, Letter Generation.

Added Internal Controls. Amended and renamed IRM 7.14.4.1, Program, Scope and Objectives. Added IRM 7.14.4.1.1, Background; IRM 7.14.4.1.2, Authority; IRM 7.14.4.1.3, Responsibilities; and IRM 7.14.4.1.4, Acronyms.
EFFECT ON OTHER DOCUMENTS
This supersedes IRM 7.14.4 dated September 2, 2015.
Tax Exempt and Government Entities Employee Plans
Table of Contents
Letter Generation System (LGS)
Letter Generation Menu Create or Update Entity Information Creating and Updating Letters Printing Letters
) LGS is a subsystem of the Inventory Control System (ICS). At the ICS Main Menu (See Exhibit
), select option
to access the Letter Generation (LG) Menu (Exhibit
) At the LG Menu, you can access these screens: a. Create/Update Entity Information - (Exhibit
) b. Create/Update Letter - (Exhibit
) c. Letter Format and Printing - (Exhibit

) Speciﬁcally, we use LGS to: a. Update entity information. b. Generate letters. c. Update previously created letters. d. Reprint letters. Caution: Do not update entity information in EDS on any case you are working in TEDS. Use TEDS to create/update all entity information or an EDS block will be created. (
) Letter records are stored on EDS until the EDS System Administrator runs archiving program. Records are only archived if a closing letter is created the case. (

, IRM
, states the Director, Employee Plans authority to issue favorable DLs on the qualiﬁed status of: a. Pension, proﬁt-sharing, stock bonus, annuity, and employee stock ownership plans under IRC

7.14 Employee Plans EDS User Manual

Acronym Deﬁnition DL Determination Letter EP Employee Plans EDS EP/EO Determination System ICS Inventory Control System LG Letter Generation LGS Letter Generation System QA Quality Assurance TEDS Tax Exempt Determination System

) Entity information is automatically transferred from the Data Transcription System (DTS) or TEDS to LGS. If entity information is not present or is incorrect for a case, you can add/correct it in LGS before you create a letter. (
) Select option
(Create or Update Letter) to update entity information and create a letter. (
) Select option
(Create or Update Entity) to update entity information without creating a letter.
7.14.4.2(09-02-2015) Creating or Updating Entity Information
Caution: Do not use option 3 to create an entity because it creates an appli- cation in status 90 which can’t be worked.
) The Create or Update Entity Information screen (Exhibit

) displays after you select these options. When you enter any character (lower or upper case) on this screen, the system automatically converts it to upper case when saved. Make any necessary changes and press F
to advance to the next screen.
Letters (
) The Create/Update Letter screen (Exhibit
) displays after you select option
(Create or Update Letter) on the LG Menu and update any entity formation. (
) The two major parts to create a letter are selecting the addressee(s) and entering the letter text. (
) Select the addressee by placing an “X” before the Taxpayer, POA
and/or POA
boxes. The POA(s) information must be displayed on the Create or Update Entity Information screen before you can enter an “X”. (
) Add any paragraph codes in the Para/Variable section of the screen. See
, Letter Generation , for a description of automatic, required, selective, and customized paragraphs. (
) After you complete the Create/Update Letter screen and press F
key, the Letter Format Screen (Exhibit
) displays.

Select the addressee by placing an “X” before the Taxpayer, POA 1 and/or POA 2 boxes. The POA(s) information must be displayed on the Create or Update Entity Information screen before you can enter an “X”.
After you complete the Create/Update Letter screen and press F5 key, the Letter Format Screen (Exhibit 7.14.4-5) displays.

(01) Query/Update Master Record and Status
***Select one of the above:
Validity Checks
Must be one of the valid option numbers (00 - 12).
(1) Select option 4 on the ICS Menu and you’ll see the LG Menu.
NOTE: The DLN search will NOT ﬁnd cases that are older than 9 years.

(2) Enter option number 1, 2, or 3, the DLN, EDS or TEDS case number, and number. Press F1. If you don’t enter the DLN, EDS/TEDS case number, or enter them incorrectly, or if the entity does not exist, an error message displays.

(3) If you select option 1 and there aren’t input errors, the Create/Update Entity In- formation - Employee Plans screen (Exhibit 7.14.4-3) displays. If there is an input error, correct the search information and press F1.
(4) If you select option 2 and there aren’t input errors, the Print Format/Selection screen (Exhibit 7.14.4-5) displays. If there is an input error, correct the search infor- mation and press F1.

(5) If you select option 3 and there aren’t input errors, the Create/Update Entity In- formation - Employee Plans screen (Exhibit 7.14.4-3) displays. If there is an input error, correct the search information and press F1.
DESCRIPTION
Use with options 1, 2, or 3. If not used, enter EDS Case Number or TEDS Case Number - must be numeric.

Enter the letter number created or reprinted for options and 2 and it must be numeric. The letter number must exist in the EDS letter text. See IRM 7.13.5, Letter Gen- eration for available letter numbers.
Use with options 1, 2, or 3. If not used, enter DLN or TEDS case Number - must be numeric.
Use with options 1, 2, or 3. If not used, enter DLN or EDS Case Number - must be numeric.
Exhibit 7.14.4-3 (06-07-2012) Create or Update Entity Information
(1) Select option 1 or 3 from the LG Menu and this screen displays. Use this screen to update entity informa- tion.
(1) Select option 1 or 3 from the LG Menu and this screen displays. Use this screen to update entity informa-
Caution: Only update an existing application if it is not being worked in TEDS. Otherwise, an EDS block is created.

) If you select option
on the LG Menu, this screen displays entity information. If a blank screen displays, the entity does not exist and you should press F
to return to the LG Menu. If information displays, review the entity information for accuracy and correct any errors (not applicable for TEDS cases) and press F

to save changes. If EDS does not pass the validity checks (below), an error message displays and the cursor is positioned on the ﬁeld in error. Correct the error (not ap- plicable for TEDS cases) and press F
Press F
if you do not want to save changes. The LG Menu (Exhibit
) displays when you press either F

Exhibit 7.14.4-3 (Cont. 1) (06-07-2012) Create or Update Entity Information

(3) If you select option 1 on the LG Menu, this screen displays entity information. The screen functions the same as described in (2) above except that the Create or Update Letter screen (Exhibit 7.14.4-4) displays when you press F1.
Employer Identiﬁcation Number. Must be a valid EIN. The ﬁrst two digits must be in the valid range as follows:
Plan number. If entered, must be numeric.
File Folder Number. If entered, must be numeric. First two digits must match the ﬁrst two digits of the Case Number.
Display only.

Must be entered. If the Plan Sponsor Name is more than 35 characters long, continue on line 2; do not break a word after 35 characters. Carry the full word or grouping to line 2. All 35 positions of line 1 do not have to be ﬁlled to continue on line 2. Valid charac- ters are any key on the keyboard, however, the ﬁrst position must be alphabetic or numeric. No charac- ters may follow two consecutive blanks, except blanks.
If entered, Plan Sponsor Name (Line 1) must be entered. See Plan Sponsor Name (Line 1).
If entered, Plan Sponsor Name (Lines 2 and 3) must be entered. See Plan Sponsor Name (Line 1).
Exhibit 7.14.4-3 (Cont. 3) (06-07-2012) Create or Update Entity Information
DESCRIPTION
Must be entered. The valid characters are any key on the keyboard, however the ﬁrst character must be alphabetic or numeric. No characters may follow two consecutive blanks except blanks.

Note: If this is a foreign address, enter the City on the Address Line. Enter the foreign Country on this line. If this is a MILITARY address, FPO or APO must be entered on this line if State is “AA”, “AE” or “AP.”
Must be entered. Must be a valid state abbreviation or for foreign addresses, a period followed by a blank (.). If this is a MILITARY address, enter the following:
Must be entered and numeric. The number making up the ﬁrst 5 positions must be greater than 00600. If this is a MILITARY address, the zip code must be in the following ranges:
A validity check is executed on EDS to verify the state and zip code. If an invalid zip code is entered, the system message will ask you to verify the current zip code or correct.

May or may not be entered. If entered “POA (1) (Line 1)” must be entered. Valid characters are any key on the keyboard, however if any data is entered, the ﬁrst position must be alphabetic or numeric. No char- acters may follow two consecutive blanks except blanks.
May or may not be entered. If entered, the ﬁrst position must be alphabetic or numeric. The valid characters are any key on the keyboard.

Must be entered if “POA (1) (Line 1)” is entered. The valid characters are any key on the keyboard, however the ﬁrst position must not be blank. No con- secutive characters may follow two blanks except blanks. If this is a MILITARY address, FPO or APO must be entered on this line if State is “AA”, “AE” or “AP.”
A validity check is executed on EDS to verify the state and zip code. If an invalid zip code is entered the system message will ask you to verify the current zip code or correct.
See Power of Attorney (1), item 12, above.

Exhibit 7.14.4-4 (06-07-2012) Creating and Updating Letters
(1) Select option 1 on the LG Menu and press F1 in the Create or Update Entity Information screen and this screen displays. Use this screen to create, update and review a letter.

EDS-LGS-5 CREATE/UPDATE LETTER EIN: FORM/PLAN: FFN: LETTER CODE: Addressee (Place x before) TAXPAYER POA 1 POA 2 Para Variable Para Variable Para Variable Required Paragraph w/ Variable - Enter Paragraph Number
Required Paragraph w/ Variable - Enter Paragraph Number
Hit F1-Execute, F4-Delete, F10-Exit
(2) This screen displays letter information if a letter was previously created for the application. Otherwise the screen is blank.

(3) Enter the ﬁelds according to the validity checks below. See IRM 7.13.5, Letter Generation , for a list of all available EDS paragraphs and IRM 7.11.5, Proper Use of Determination Letter Caveats , for commonly used EDS paragraphs for Letters 1132 and 5274.
(4) Press F1.
(5) If EDS does not pass the validity checks, an error message displays and the cursor is positioned on the ﬁeld in error. Correct the error and press F1 again. If

(5) If EDS does not pass the validity checks, an error message displays and the cursor is positioned on the ﬁeld in error. Correct the error and press F1 again. If there aren’t input errors and you entered customized paragraphs numbers, the Create/Update Letter (Continued) screen displays. Continue at (8), below. If there aren’t input errors and you didn’t enter customized paragraphs numbers, a message to press F5 displays. If you make any additional changes to letter, press F1 again to save the new changes. Once the letter is complete, press F5 to save and print the letter. The Print Format/Selection screen (Exhibit 7.14.4-5) displays.
Exhibit 7.14.4-4 (Cont. 1) (06-07-2012) Creating and Updating Letters
(6) Press F4 to delete a letter from the system.
(7) Press F10 to exit the screen without saving changes.
DESCRIPTION
Display only. Employer Identiﬁcation Number.
Display only. Plan number for EP.
Display only. File folder number. Will be blank if FFN was not entered in the Create/Update Entity screen.
Enter an “X” if a copy of the letter is to be sent to the Plan Sponsor or Organization.
Enter an “X” if a copy of the letter is being sent to the POA. If the POA Name is not displayed, an “X” may not be entered.
Paragraph codes. Enter all 8000 series paragraphs displayed, any selective or customized paragraphs.

Variable text consisting of 1 to 20 characters that is inserted in the paragraph number entered. Enter the text that should be inserted into the variable. The text is printed exactly as entered. Upper and lower case characters must be entered where desired.
(8) When you enter a customized paragraph code (9000-9999) on the Create/ Update Letter screen, this screen displays.
Customized Paragraph Code:
(10) Enter or correct the customized paragraph. See IRM 7.11.5.5, Additional Guidance / Common Errors , when adding customized paragraphs.
(11) Press the F1 key. You’ll see one of the following:
Another customized paragraph if you created more than one. Another blank screen if you entered more than one
series paragraph number on the Create/ Update Letter screen. The Create/Update Letter screen if you didn’t enter any more
series paragraphs. The message to press the F
key displays.
(12) Press F4 to delete a 9000 paragraph from the letter.

(14) Once the Create/Update Letter screen displays, a message to press F5 displays. If you change any other items on the letter, press F1 again to save the new changes. If you press F1, continue at (8), above. When you complete the letter, press F5 to save and print it. The Print Format/Selection screen (Exhibit 7.14.4-5) displays.
Exhibit 7.14.4-4 (Cont. 3) (06-07-2012) Creating and Updating Letters
DESCRIPTION

Display only. Employer Identiﬁcation Number. Display only. Plan number for EP. Display only. File folder number. Will be blank unless FFN has been entered in the Create/Update Entity screen. Display only. Letter number entered in the Letter Gen- eration Menu screen. Display only. Plan Sponsor or Organization name. Display only.
series paragraph number entered the previous screen. Enter the text of the paragraph in exact format it should be printed. The text can be up to ten (
)* lines
Display only. File folder number. Will be blank unless a FFN has been entered in the Create/Update Entity screen.
Display only. 9000 series paragraph number entered in the previous screen.
Enter the text of the paragraph in exact format it should be printed. The text can be up to ten (10)* lines of 79 characters each.

*NOTE: When beginning a paragraph, always leave the ﬁrst line blank. Begin text on the second line. If the paragraph is long enough to require two screens (two 9000 series) enter a second paragraph number.
(1) Press F5 in the Create/Update Letter screen and this screen displays. Use this screen to print the letter.
* Address Paragraph for Form 9098
(2) The last line “Address Paragraph for Form 9098” only displays if you add para- graphs 6 and 8503 to a Letter 1132.
(3) Enter the ﬁelds according to the validity checks below. See your manager for the left margin and print mode used in your Post of Duty.
(4) Press F1.

(5) When there aren’t input errors, more print screens will display. See your manager for the correct information to add to these print screens. The LG Menu (Exhibit 7.14.4-3) displays after the letter prints.
(6) When there is an input error, the error message displays and the cursor is posi- tioned on the ﬁeld in error.
Exhibit 7.14.4-5 (Cont. 1) (04-15-2003) Printing Letters
Must be numeric. Enter the ﬁve digit EDS Employee/ Specialist number.
Must be numeric. Maximum margin is 19 spaces. See your manager for the margin to use in your Post of Duty (POD).
Valid entries are B, N, S, T, V, 1 - 9 or blank. Blank will default to “B.” See your manager for the mode to use in your POD.
T - send to a text printer S - sent to a slaved printer B - set up letter for batch print N - save letter but not print it V - view a letter just created
- locally deﬁned print modes
If “T” entered in the print mode, must be a printer number. Must be numeric.
